Description: Gold finger-ring; lower part of loop has elaborate incised decoration; the shoulders are open and v-shaped; between the shoulders is openwork decoration on either side; there are three band-settings: the central one is oval and contains a piece of green glass, the outer are rectangular (holding a convex plasma) and oval (now empty) respectively.
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (793)
Yeroulanou 1999 / Diatrita: Gold Pierced-Work Jewellery from the 3rd to the 7th Century (298)
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Rev Greville John Chester
